snippet.title: Utah Amber Alert issued for two girls
snippet.description:
Utah Amber Alert issued for two girls

(KUTV) An Utah Amber Alert has been issued for two girls, 4 and 8 years old.
Police are looking for Elizabeth Dinah Coltharp, 8, and Hattie Briella Coltharp, 4. They are believed to be with Samuel Warren Shaffer, 34.
Police said Shaffer was seen with the two girls along with his own two daughters Lillie and Samantha Shaffer. They were seen on foot but it is not known if there is a vehicle involved.
2News will update this story as more information becomes available.
Elizabeth Cotharp, 8, is described as:
4 feet 9 inches tall
45 pounds
Brown hair
Brown eyes
Last seen wearing a blue dress, gray pants under the dress, wearning hiking books which are possibly camouflaged and a camouflaged jacked.
Hattie Briella Coltharp is 4, is described as:
2 feet 10 inches tall
37 pounds
Brown hair
Brown eyes
Last seen wearing blue spandex pants with purple polka dots and short sleeve shirt of an undetermined color
Suspected abductor Samual Warren Shaffer, 34, is described as:
5 feet 10 inches tall
160 pounds
Brown hair
Hazel eyes
Last seen wearing black pants, a black puffy coat, comouflaged boonie hat
A Facebook page called Help us find the Coltharps has information that KUTV can not verify but may be information useful to finding the missing children.
GRANTSVILLE, Utah (ABC4 Utah) An Amber Alert was canceled after it was issued for two girls age 7 and 11 outside Grantsville Wednesday afternoon.  
 
Officials said the girls were taken from 313 S. Cooley St. around 2:15 p.m. Investigators said the father was issued papers that gave temporary custody to the girls mother. When she went to pick them up they were gone.
 
The suspect and father of the children, 53 year old Kenneth Shrewsbury,  was eventually found in Magna. According to family he was visiting his mother when he heard about the alert.
 
According to Grantsville police, the father and mother are in a custody dispute. They said he voluntarily brought is daughters to a Unified Police Department substation in Magna. 
 
Shrewsbury was taken to the Tooele County Jail, but it's unclear what he will be charged with. The girls are back with their mother.
